number of helpful: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 11, 2015
												There's an excellent concept here, the mechanics aren't too horrifically unbalanced, and the play (once you get used to it) is pretty fun for a while.On the other hand, extremely poor documentation (There are 6 wikis I found in my googling for answers, each of which was incorrect about the game in multiple, significant ways), exceedingly poor performance with big ships (My 720 block ship with 18 crew members caused the game to grind to a halt on a computer with 4x the system requirements whenever I entered combat, or the ship editor), lacking control over the crew (Want to have your crew repair the ship more than clean? Too bad. If they know both skills, then in the middle of combat, they'll run around cleaning. Want to have all the pirates on the island return without disrupting the pirates on the ship? Too bad, there's no way to do that.) and a general feeling that this game is not merely incomplete, but fundamentally flawed in multiple game ruining ways makes this an experience to avoid.There's very little in the way of a tutorial, which makes the initial experience Googling laden, and more than a bit frustrating.There's bugs. A pirate hit by a cannon blast can be knocked into a wall, and unable to escape it. If that pirate poops before you can get to a dock to remove the wall, the poop will prevent you from removing that block, leaving the only option to take another ship, or entirely rebuild yours.There's incorrect documentation, everywhere, on every site, regardless of whether it says official.I expected better from Re-Logic, and I'm unclear on why this is out of Early Access.Some things that make this game feel incomplete:When you are on the map screen, pressing wasd doesn't move your view of the map screen around. Even worse, pressing up/down switches you over to the character screen, for some reason. For that matter, pressing up/down on the ship builder also drops you unceremoniously into the character screens.There's no way to manually aim cannons, or continue the cannon fire when ships are in boarding range.Ships don't move closer to each other as they approach boarding range.Cannons don't become more accurate as ships come into boarding range.There's no way to prevent your cannons from firing, if you wish to capture the enemy ship.You have to click a button to open treasure chests. Seriously, in what circumstances would a pirate not want to open a treasure chest?Crew that you have trained up in levels don't become more valuable if you go to sell them back. The same applies when they learn skills, which costs you for the books.There is no option for networked play, non-randomly generated worlds, or multiple humans on a single system controlling different pirates.You cannot place food on your ship if you aren't at a town/island. While we're at it, you can't have a pirate whose job it is to keep food stocked on deck.There's no options to change the frequency of pirate dialog, add or remove some lines, or include custom audio snippets.There's no option to import a pirate flag from an image, or export one to share around.There's no option to capture a picture of your ship to share.There're no options to automatically spend TP.Your gunning crew doesn't move closer to the cannons when you're heading towards battle. Your boarding crew doesn't move closer to the front of the ship when battle begins, or when you're heading towards battle. If you order the boarding crew to the front of the ship, they will disperse after a short time.If your captain is in the midst of battle, there seems to be no way to make him retreat, even when he's fast enough, and dodging enough of the blows that he could easily get away. Sometimes clicking furiously where I wanted him to go seemed to work.

												This game is fine. I can't recommend it based on the performance and UI problems. Toward the end of the game I had stuttering so bad I couldn't even move the camera. This made placing items on your ship even more tedious. The UI also had me frustrated at many points and it was only until later I figured out I could scroll the list of items you can equip on a pirate. SO MUCH CLICKING. An inventory that let you select multiple items would have gone a long way. Buying 10x an item and having to click for each was brutal.There needed to be some more automation with the elements that were tedious (placing food, leveling up pirates). It would have been better if their were less weapons but they were more diverse. I was drowning in weapons and just gave up figuring out which ones did what when usually the ones that were already leveled are the best.The ship building is fun although extremely pointless. Allowing the player to customize their experience with their own ship and naming of their pirates is what this game did best.I hate to be so negative because I could see the potential of a game like this but this one fell short.

content:
Posted: January 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								HOLY ♥♥♥♥ MY♥♥♥♥♥♥AND GO♥♥♥♥♥♥SOME BRICKS THIS GAME IS AMAZING! Ive only played a bit of it and i cant even fathom how much more stuff I have to discover. This game is a hilarious, cute and funny pixel by pixel rendition of what it would be like to be a pirate!It has a serious, "Its a permadeath game so dont like, ... die." element to it but it seems to focus more on the side of, "Game Over! you got killed by a chicken!" (That actually happened like to me) The funny and goofy side while funny, somehow dosent take to much away from the game like most, "Goofy" games do.The ship building, while it has a slight learning curve manages to be simple, easy and fun. Though your first ship will most definatly look like a large piece of Caribbian Seagul feces, you will quickly catch on and find a sophisticated design that works for you!The RPG side of the game and the complicated leveling system may look daunting at first, but give it maybe, 3 times around of playing the game and getting you♥♥♥♥♥handed too you and you will quickly undersand why it is 300 pieces of gold to train a crew member to clean the seagull crap off you deck. The leveling system may have a rather large learning curve but it too, is quite sophisticated and well thought through.Now, the hard part...Combat. for most players, your first hour will mainly consist of repeatedly getting your♥♥♥♥♥handed too you by an oyster or a cute little chicken, (By the way the animation for killing those feathery sons-a-♥♥♥♥♥es is extremly satisfying, as with every other death animation, even when your precious captain dies a wonderstruck sense of awe hits you like a♥♥♥♥♥♥covered brick to the face.) I will admit it is a little bit unpolished, but I see the potential in it. As of right now it isnt the easiest to handle, (My stategy is buying every crew member I can find and then rushing in and hope one of them is still alive after.) But nevertheless it shows unprecidentable promise. (I really hope i spelt that right and used it correctly in the right context.)...(I has bad englishes)So in short, This game is Amazing and buy it right now, support the developers and help them make it better... Its worth it.All the best game playening,      DelusionalKitty

number of helpful: 9 of 17 people (53%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 8, 2014
Early Access Review
								As one of the first 10 voters on greenlight and one of the first to try the demo and experience the full steam early access version, I thought it was only right to write a review giving my deepest and most precise thoughts on the game. So no more jibber-jatter, lets start reviewing.Pixel Piracy is a sidescrolling 2D Pirate Simulator, yes, simulator. The words might be a shock to you as the game looks very, very silly and cute, however it precisely simulates how pirates were in the 1800's, because, of course we all know pirates had floating ships, no sails, and of course, submarines and poles out of wood. Becides that, though, the game is very realistic in terms of the hardcore (No respawn) and fighting and survival aspects of the game. Food, weapons, money, salaries, are all active needs for you and your crew to survive on these great seas. You can make your own ships block by block from what you buy at shops, you can plunder enemy ships, and islands, take there ships. And even buy rum to really get the feeling of piracy. Taking slaves and prisoners is an upcoming feature I am really looking forward too. The game is in real time, and is single player. AT-THE-MOMENT. They have promised a multiplayer (No info on that yet) upon release, which I am very excited to see how it's all peaced together!Rate: 8.7/10. (This may change depending on updates)---(No need to read this)If you guys like my reviews or anything please be sure to follow me around and check out my other reviews on games like Door Kickers, DayZ, etc. I'm not much a diehard fan for any game so most if not all my reviews are completely honest, and thanks for reading, feel free for feedback and rate!---

content:
Posted: December 27, 2014
												I really was looking forward to this game being a fun, exploratory and great mechanics but it fell short on all three accounts.At the start of the game I had a great feeling and energy that this was going to be fun. Granted, the first 3-4 times I had trouble surviving and making it as a scurvy seadog. But then I figured out the game and then everything was a breeze to progress from early game to mid and late game. That is also a downside with the game, a lack of any kind of useful tutorial, you just have to read and read alot of text in a help screen (which to me screams the devs just wanted this game out, at whatever quality). The second thing that strikes me is the horrible control scheme and GUI. You can only really precision control your own unit (the captain) and everyone else does their best to do what you tell them. Some commands are "drag" commands and some are "action" commands and I don't see a reason why the control of your crew should be this bad. When you order your crew to move, all run as fast as possible to that spot, meaning the fastest guy gets there first, but might not engage the enemy first cause they engage in wierd ways. The control of the crew and pets is aweful, have not been thought out and when boarding ships with a crew, some can fall into the water directly killing them or makes them unavaiable for a time if you're lucky. Another minor gripe is the constant is the constant nagging if you want to "save", and you can just tell it to not ask you in the next 10 minutes, but then you can't save in over 10 minutes which is real bad.Your crew can be trained in skills aswell as your captain, like fishing (which is useful as it gives you free food), and cooking (to coock the free fish). This system is extremely flawed and if you would like to have a crew that can both catch & cook fish and clean, they will be almost useless. This is because fishing takes a bit of time, and while the rod is out in the water, the desire to clean (tossing poo overboard, fitting description later on?) comes on and ABORTS the fishing. So  a sole crewman with the fishing skill is required to catch alot of fish. This could be okay if not for items on your ship disrupt your crew in the same manner. Yes, items on your ship like playing cards, sword practice or reading books stops your crew randomly from doing what they can, just to give them some morale or more Training points. It's flawed once again, you can work around the broken mechanics, but what's the point if you can't play the game as you want?I have many more gripes about this game and I just think this game becomes an utter disappointment at the end. I like to make my captain a strong soldier alone in my second playthrough to have control and it was a breeze to clear ship after ship with just him. even the bosses. And getting there was soo boring and repetitive. The potential for what could have been is huge!!! But this is just a skeleton with no added meat or flavor to it, it is just not a good game i'm sad to say. I just can't recommend this game to my friends because then I would be ashamed and they would hate it, it just isn't worth any more time.Pros:+ Nice pixelart+ Good character customization, differnet voices and looks+ Build your own ship, sail the seas (in the start)Cons:- Slow paced. Going on land is slow and tedious and have to wait minutes to get any buisness done. More fun if paced more correctly with the actual content.- Sailing. a core mechanic is "sail-time". You see your boat travel and you crew working, but is really a boring wait screen- Random Generator. yeah, it works, but it doesn't tell what the worldcreator options really do and can make maps really hard or really easy- Crew control. You really can't control them, commands are clunky and don't work as advertiesed.- Crew. Don't see a reason for them unless they fish for you.- Skills and Items. Both of them interupts other skills and jobs, making having both not an option.- Lack of variation. both in what you explore, music and combat.- Difficulty. Only challanging in the beginning, then a grindfest begins, then you can kill the bosses.- GUI. Some icons you drag, some buttons you click, some commands don't work and no control over individuals.- Boarding. Sometimes your crew could board the enemy just to fall off and die. You can board outside of the boarding phase.There are probably more problems that I've forcefully pushed out of my memory. But this is not a well-made, polished game. But a broken mess of great potential. This game falls short and would get a 3/10 if I would grade it.

												Do what you want cause a pirate is free!! YOU ARE A MICROMANAGER....So bitterly disappointed,  a good chunk of your time later on is spent managing rum and food stores. I've just spent the last few hours trying to get a balance between crew size and resources. Exploring is hard when you need to dock or get resources for your men every few minutes (I'm playing on Easy too). The combat is non existent too, you just click a location and watch. It's a shame as the game has a charm about it but it's too flabby and overweight. I often judge games by how much "fun" time there is per "play" time. This one actually decreases as you play :-(Trying to palm off a Alpha build as a full 1.0 retail... Appalling.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2014
												Pixel Piracy was not exactly a game that I was looking for, but after picking it up, it definitely surprised me in how fun the game actually was. Graphically, the game is quite charming. Gameplay itself is an interesting mix of hands on and hands off. And the sandbox-esque way of creating your ship is quite lovely. The audio is a bit more of a mixed front for me than others, but all in all, positive.When it comes to how the game looks, Pixel Piracy is very much a retro throwback indy title. It's filled with lots of lovely blocky pixels, and really has that old school charm to it. If you are a fan of the low res, chunky looking games, the art alone just might sell Pixel Piracy to you. The only visuals that seem a bit mismatched and out of place are the sails and the sea itself. While every other bit of Pixel Piracy is nice and blocky, the sails and the water look more modern, and it can be a bit offputting.The gameplay of Pixel Piracy is wonderful! It is an interesting merger between a god game, and a game with a bit finer tuned controls. With the exception of more absolute control over the captain of your ship, most of the sailors go about their business as they please. (Particularly if they are unhappy!) Unless you select the ship group the sailor is directly associated with, getting them to move where you want is impossible. It can be a bit frusturating at first, but it really spices up the gameplay when you're trying your best to keep newer shipmates alive during a wild brawl amid decks!Pixel Piracy has the appeal that most sandbox games have. Do what you want, when you want, and the way you want. Moving up from a dinky little boat to a massive customized warship takes time, but finally getting there really feels rewarding! Building up a ship from scratch and using it to mow down lower tiered pirate ships is just a great feeling.The audio in Pixel Piracy is the one area that may need a bit of work. The shanties are funny, but limited. The sound effects in general are quite fitting to the game, to be completely fair. The real issue is how sailors will begin to have a "conversation" onboard your ship, which basically just results in them filling your ears with "Yo ho!", "Dead men tell no tales", "Blow the man down", and "Shiver me timbers!" over and over and over again. It was funny at first, but as the game progresses it does begin to wear on you a bit.Overall Pixel Piracy is a GREAT game! Sailing around the world, sinking the ships of your unworthy foes, and conquering islands gives the game a lot of replay value.  8.5/10

content:
Posted: August 19, 2014
												I played this game for about 20 hours (had some connection issues, so I played half the time in offline mode). While I like many of its features like : bounty hunting, the possibility to build your own ship....                                                  This game feels like it's still in alpha version! - It takes 3-8hours to beat the game(depends on playstyle) - it's extremely easy! even in "hard"difficulty, you are not going to break a sweat beating the game.- This game is full of bugs. some of them gamebreaking.(better be careful 'when' to save or you will end up starting a new game).- The only objective the game currently has, is to kill all four "Legendary" pirates, after that you can.. enjoy the unchallenging battles, and the unrewarding exploration this game has to offer.- All npc's are sharing the same personality, they are all saying the same things over and over.- The trolling music and voice acting are okay.... at  first. but they are known to cause severe headaches after extended exposure ;)- Stupid cannon AI. enemy cannons have most (if not all) of their attention locked on a single person, so if you put him in the. right place, they are not even gonna hit the ship.-All the Islands look almost the same, and feel the same.( the towns too).- Zero replayablity value. Due to the limited content .I can not recommend this game in it's current state(for any price higher than 3 bucks) . If it was in alpha version I would say that it has potential,but it's not.The developers are pretty active though... maybe one day Pixel Piracy will be the game it was meant to be.my rating for the current version of the game is a 5.5/10

content:
Posted: February 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								First impressions: http://www.cublikefoot.com/pixel-piracy-first-impressions/Yes, a pirate simulator. Pixel Piracy is a pirate simulator. Now, who wouldn’t want to try out a pirate simulator?It may sound fun, but it is really, really hard. The game also has permadeath, which just adds to the fun, well, if you’re good at the game at least. You’ll need to start by building a ship and, optionally, hiring a someone to be on your crew. The crew system is a bit annoying, because oftentimes the crew will just ignore your orders because they lack loyalty. Loyalty can be gained by paying them in gold, the game’s currency.The game’s shipbuilding is a bit weird. My first ship looked like a block, but it still worked. In fact, all of the early game enemies also had terrible-looking ships, just like mine. Later in the game, you’ll get to build cooler ships, assuming you don’t die along the way. I’ve yet to get far enough to build a really fancy ship, so I’ll just stick with my floating blocks of wood for now. Pixel Piracy also has an RPG element to go along with it. It’s rather complex, but adds a lot to the game and I really enjoy its addition.Early-game, I had a lot of trouble with combat. I was terrible at it. The combat is really unpredictable, there is little to no indication of whether or not you will win a fight. With more crewmates, however, the chances of winning in combat rise immensely, especially when you’ve got six or so guys and they got three. The combat could be better, but the game is in early access, so changes could be made along the way.Although the game is difficult, I find enjoyment in it anyways. I’ll get better at it as I play, for sure.

												This is a darn cotton pick'n good game. The learning curve is steep as there are not really any complete instructions. Its a lot of testing out things. There are a few things that are in game but are presently useless until the next update. However, this game is sick. I get to pirate pixels with out breaking copyright laws!Basically you start out answering a series of questions which tailor your game experience, which are questions about your past and the world around you. You must plunder or take a prize from pirates around your skill level or less unless your up for some random chance at glory and risk dying a bloody ugly death. As you train your mates, it seems that the trick is stacking early intelligence on about 5 pirates, outfitting them with jobs from your home island. No starter pirate seems to know how to clean his own crap up much less do anything worth while like fish, you have to LEARN em good. That costs money. You can train pets, when your attacked they will defend you if your boarded. Its actually really addicting, though I am reaching my limit and at this point the replay value would only be upped by new features.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 8, 2015
												A cute idea hampered by horrible implementation and a startling lack of polish all combine into an awful game. Let's take it apart, piece by piece-Graphics(3/10)- Obviously one of the first things you'll notice about the game, Pixel Piracy falls pretty flat here. First off, the entire game is smothered in a layer of bloom that adjusting the game's graphics settings seems to do nothing to lessen. I'm fairly certain there are only two backgrounds in the entire game, one for land, and one for sea, and neither are very interesting. And while there's not really anything wrong with the actual visual game elements, it looks like the sort of pixel style that is not done to deliberately invoke a retro or indie feel, but one that comes of a developer who is either very lazy or very short on funds. The characters are ugly, the items are unrecognizable, and the game world is just incredibly samey. So, in short, while it's not physically painful to look at, that's really the best I can say of it, and even that's not true sometimes.Sound(1/10)- Jesus god in heaven help me. If you can play this for more than a minute with the sound on, you are a stronger person than I will ever be. The game's bgm consists of 4, maybe five, tracks that are nothing but 30-45 second loops of the most utterly uninspired MIDI music you can imagine. Incredibly, that's the good part of the sound design, because all the effects are even worse. The general game sound effects are repetitive and aggravating, but they pale in comparison to the game's voice clips. Every different character in this game is assigned one of an astoundingly large number of 2 second clips of what I can only assume are people the devs pulled off the street to read Klingon backwards into 50 year old microphones. And the game is really proud of them, so it plays one for you every time ANYTHING happens, which equates to about 6000 times on every single sailing voyage you take. Maybe that's not enough for you? How about "sea shanties"? By which I mean another awful MIDI track under a tinny voice that makes me want to poke my eardrums out crooning some hilariously cringeworthy g-rated pirate themed lyrics. Because that's what this game has to offer. You get the picture. I hope you get the picture. Please don't make me talk about the game's sound anymore.Story(Not even really applicable/10)- There isn't any. That's it. Probaby better that way, to be honest. Moving on.Gameplay(2/10)- This section is depressingly similar to the last one. The "gameplay" can really be divided into three categories: preparing to do stuff, doing stuff, and waiting for the stuff you've done to happen. The preparing to do stuff is probably where you'll spend a majority of the game. This accounts for all time spent in shops and menus and stat screens. this is where you hire crew members and buy weapons and upgrade your ship and teach your crew how to poop properly (no, really). This is the closest the game the game comes to being fun, but it would come a lot closer if any of this crap I've mentioned ACTUALLY WORKED. This game legitmately has the least intuitive and most perplexing UI I've ever encountered. Equipment screens are confusing, skills are absurd, and whoever thought doing 90% of all in-game actions from a pause screen was a good idea really oughta be killed. But once you've emerged from the menu maze you get the tremendous pleasure of ...*wait for it*... clicking. That's it. That's all you really get to do. You click. To attack or to move or to dig or to plunder, you click. Once. Maybe twice. And then you wait. Absolutely NOTHING in this game is in a hurry. Sailing is slow, your crew moves slow, scroling the camera is slow. And then, once you're done waiting, head back to the menus. I am in no way exaggerating when I say that's all there is to the game. That's literally it. And don't think for a second that there are a variety of environements to explore. You've got your towns, your deserted islands, your open sea, and your ship battles. Once again, no exaggeration. That's it. And I'm really not kidding about this game's bizarre obsession with poop. There are a myriad of skills, items, and acheivements relating to fecal matter. Kind fitting really.So, wouldn't it be nice to have a game where you could design your own captain and build your own ship and mold your own crew and sail the open seas to find treaure, love, and destiny? You better believe it would. Is that game Pixel Piracy? No. No it is not.2/10, incredibly disappointing, do not purchase.

												Do you like RPGs? Do you like pirates? Do you like minor pixelated violence (Cuz I do :) ). Do you like to make your bases look like anything? If you said yes to any of these then you may want to have a look at Pixel Piracy.Pros: Free roam, RPG, Tons of skills for characters you can get, a lot of ally pirates with custom skills (All are nameable), Plenty of Islands to raid, THE POOP DECK!!!! (He He), make your ship a huge (or just steal one from an enemy pirate), and pets such as: birds, turtles, crabs, giant spiders, and many more.Cons: sometimes the AI is unstable such as stopping what they are doing for no reason or won't listen at all to you, no animations to characters, and skills must be bought in stores in the game (characters can't just think "I'm gonna shoot cannons as a skill" you have to buy that skill and use one of their skill points when they level up) or an ally may start with a really bad skill that does not help in combat.Overall I really like this game and I recommend this game to RPG players. leave a like if this helped

Pros: +Its Made by Re-Logic which means IT NEVER STOPS GETTING BETTER!+Some Call this game repetitive but to me with all these new updates theres so much to do!+You can make your own adventure. Its never quite the same!: -Picking what your dad was-Killing everyone in the tavern and then never coming back!-Crew not knowing how to just take a dump off the side of the ship -And much much more!?!+Player  Customization +Good Graphics +So many more things that words can`t describeCons:-Pirates Having a bad Ai {I`m sure it will be fixed!}Now i have just one con but that is because there is not anything bad to say about the game. Everything that was bad has been fixed and little bugs just make the game even more worth while. People can come and go saying that this game is "un finished" or "a grindy game" but to me its all for the laughs. I named my pirates after a kid shows called Jake and the Neverland Pirates. Which just made the game a whole lot more fun. I can keep making files of this game and will never end. So to finish it off just to seal the deal its made by Re-Logic. Terraria started off slow and now look at it. I stopped playing it for a week and over 1000+ items were added! It just comes to show this game just keeps getting better!

content:
Posted: April 4, 2015
												THIS GAME IS NOT AS BAD AS PEOPLE SAY!!!...  Sorry I just had to get that out there. Pixel Piracy is not a horrible game, and it certainly is not abandon because they released a update on the 30th of march! The game features no totorial other that the basic controls, this does NOT help the game because people start the game, get lost in its frustrating overly-complex menus and ui, then quit and uninstall it. But if you can get passed that and learn what to do and how to properly play the game, you will have fun. Aside from that the game is buggy but the devs are working on that, so cut them some slack, if it is still super buggy after the enhanced edition is released then there is a problem. To sum things up the game was released way too early, its very hard to start off unless you look stuff up online and read the F1 help menu and it needs a little more work. But if you are looking for a fun Rougelite with pirate theme then this is what you want. I have enjoyed  this game every minute I sank in, and it is worth it if you want a RPG Pirate game.

content:
Posted: April 26, 2015
												In Pixel Piracy you play the role of a dashing pirate of your own make. You can choose parts of your history, but what it really comes down to is your infinite hatred for poop. Left on his/her own with a boat in a land where everyone has been cursed to poop at any given moment for no reason and no matter where they are, it is up to you to establish the greatest poop cleaning ship in all the land.Our hero must go to great lengths to train his/her crew in the art of poop cleaning or even improving their skill at controlling their poop. Aside from the awesome storyline, the player is left with a lot of moral decisions like, do you go all genocide on the natives on some island just in case there might be a cleaning training book on the island? Do you attack the boat that is minding it's own business for the same reason plus a chance at taking a ship that might have more space for poop clearing facilities?If taking ships doesn't shiver your timbers, you can also build your ship up to your liking. There's a lot of value in building the ultimate ship for combatting the poop menace.All of that aside, here are some other miscellaneous features of the game that haven't been discussed above:-Have your crew poop on the enemy ship!-Watch your crew poop mid-combat!-Hire awesome warriors to defend your poop cleaning guys. (The latter are the real heros)-Defeat four major pirate bosses to distract yourself from the real war. (Talking about the war on poop)-Keep the poopdeck clean, have your men and women wear diapers!-Bras increase morale!-Mount cannons and swivel guns onto your ship and shoot at stuff! (Mounted weapons can't shoot poop though)-Be a badass!-Ignore the war on poop and watch morale drop like poop in a vacuum!-Pirate stuff! (Not really a major feature, it's more about the poop) -Scurvy!10/10 Would die of scurvy aboard a shop covered in poop again.

content:
Posted: April 27, 2015
												I didn't pick up this game until I heard that Re-Logic got some help from another developer and started fixing up some of the problems that the community had with this title and overall making this game great.That said, it's definitely worth playing.I was surprised at how deep the game is.  Each pirate you recruit, including yourself, can level up which allows you to allocate stat points on them, give them certain skills or jobs like fishing or cleaning up the ship, as well as giving each pirate a unique personality and a little bit of backstory.  There's a ton of weapons, skills, little gimmicks that you can add on to your ship to boost certain attributes or your pirates' abilities, and a lot of customization when it comes to building your ship.The UI, menus, and the controls maybe take a little bit to get used to.  It's all cluttered and hard to figure out how to navigate through them, and it's hard to know how exactly to take off blocks and add blocks to your ship.  There's also not much explanation on items in the stores so you won't really know how skills work until you spend the gold on them and try them out.  After some time with the game, this all becomes easy to deal with.When you make your world, you choose what kind of history it has and what kind of pirate you'll be, and then the world is randomly generated.  Each town and island offers something different, although it starts to get a little repetitive as an island will usually just have hostile inhabitants and maybe a treasure chest.Battles are pretty difficult at times, but rewarding whenever you get an opportunity to capture a cooler ship than the one you currently have or to blow it up and gain the loot.  The game starts to get easy once you hire a bunch of pirates and level up their stats to crazy levels to where you'll almost never lose.  It does start to become a problem as there is too much crew management rather than actually playing the game, since you have to level up each individual pirate as well as equip them with the best weapons and passive items you've got.  This starts becoming time consuming once you get to a crew size over 10+ pirates, and would maybe benefit from an auto-level up and auto-equip feature.I'm happy with this game and would love to see some more updates to it with more exciting content.  I know there's still a lot for me to see and a lot more challenges to come my way.

content:
Posted: February 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								First impressions: http://www.cublikefoot.com/pixel-piracy-first-impressions/Yes, a pirate simulator. Pixel Piracy is a pirate simulator. Now, who wouldn’t want to try out a pirate simulator?It may sound fun, but it is really, really hard. The game also has permadeath, which just adds to the fun, well, if you’re good at the game at least. You’ll need to start by building a ship and, optionally, hiring a someone to be on your crew. The crew system is a bit annoying, because oftentimes the crew will just ignore your orders because they lack loyalty. Loyalty can be gained by paying them in gold, the game’s currency.The game’s shipbuilding is a bit weird. My first ship looked like a block, but it still worked. In fact, all of the early game enemies also had terrible-looking ships, just like mine. Later in the game, you’ll get to build cooler ships, assuming you don’t die along the way. I’ve yet to get far enough to build a really fancy ship, so I’ll just stick with my floating blocks of wood for now. Pixel Piracy also has an RPG element to go along with it. It’s rather complex, but adds a lot to the game and I really enjoy its addition.Early-game, I had a lot of trouble with combat. I was terrible at it. The combat is really unpredictable, there is little to no indication of whether or not you will win a fight. With more crewmates, however, the chances of winning in combat rise immensely, especially when you’ve got six or so guys and they got three. The combat could be better, but the game is in early access, so changes could be made along the way.Although the game is difficult, I find enjoyment in it anyways. I’ll get better at it as I play, for sure.

content:
Posted: August 19, 2014
												I played this game for about 20 hours (had some connection issues, so I played half the time in offline mode). While I like many of its features like : bounty hunting, the possibility to build your own ship....                                                  This game feels like it's still in alpha version! - It takes 3-8hours to beat the game(depends on playstyle) - it's extremely easy! even in "hard"difficulty, you are not going to break a sweat beating the game.- This game is full of bugs. some of them gamebreaking.(better be careful 'when' to save or you will end up starting a new game).- The only objective the game currently has, is to kill all four "Legendary" pirates, after that you can.. enjoy the unchallenging battles, and the unrewarding exploration this game has to offer.- All npc's are sharing the same personality, they are all saying the same things over and over.- The trolling music and voice acting are okay.... at  first. but they are known to cause severe headaches after extended exposure ;)- Stupid cannon AI. enemy cannons have most (if not all) of their attention locked on a single person, so if you put him in the. right place, they are not even gonna hit the ship.-All the Islands look almost the same, and feel the same.( the towns too).- Zero replayablity value. Due to the limited content .I can not recommend this game in it's current state(for any price higher than 3 bucks) . If it was in alpha version I would say that it has potential,but it's not.The developers are pretty active though... maybe one day Pixel Piracy will be the game it was meant to be.my rating for the current version of the game is a 5.5/10

Posted: April 1
												Pirates? - check.Adventures? - check.Fancy graphics? - check.Strange noices? - check.Multiplayer? - hmm... sorry, not yet won't even have, most likely.Pixel Piracy is entertaining pixel styled game about pirates! You start with 2 men crew (including yourself), raid and pillage enemy ships, get money, buy weapons, new ships and new crew members! Then you raid and pillage more enemy ships, get more money, buy more weapons, better ships, recruit more crew members and so on! Hmm... I made it sound very boring, did not I I?... But there's not much to it, to be honest. It's not a good game for endless gameplay. It's great for people who want to play game for few minutes on free times. "there are better games if I want to spend my time if I have small free time. And they are more cheap." - you will say. You are wrong. What's better than raiding and burning enemy ships, getting money to recruit crew members, buying them cool weapons and getting them big ship?! There's nothing more interesting, of course! Plus, every pirate has different sound effect! erm... what?! They make different fancy sounds, I mean... saying some strange things which I can't remember... So, um... It's cool game, I want to say!If you ask if this game's worth buying or not, I'll tell you this: Get this game on sale. I personally got it from bundle some time ago, so I'm satisfied with it. To be honest, I don't think devs are going to make more developments to this game, so don't expect lot from it. Game's not too big, so it will get boring after a while - that's why I said it's for people who want to play a game when they have small free time on their hands. I personally have not played a lot yet, but I can say one thing for sure - I like it very much!Edit: Forgot to say, there's actually more to this game! There are poops! what?! Yes, you heard it correctly! Birds poop on your ship, so one of the crew members go and drop it into the water! Interesting, isn't it?! or I'm just strange to be interested in throwing poops into the water Only people similar to me can understand! There's also an achievement to have 5 poops on your ship at once!

												UPDATE 08/17/2014:Repetetive, fun and flavorful. $15 feels a bit much, but this is worth a sale price.Crew and ship management aside, there are only 3 actions that make up the gameplay.Visit friendly town.Visit hostile island.Visit hostile ship.All hostile encounters are very brief, which is super smart. Otherwise the repetition would be tedious. Quick encounters with quick rewards and rapidly advancing crew capabilities do an admirable job of compensating for the lack of variety in actual gameplay. One hidden gem is the soundtrack. There are some quality songs in here. Highly recommended viewing:

content:
Posted: June 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								I was expecting the same controls for Terraria/Arthur's Gold, but i was wrong.The controls are weird at first, Arrow keys/A D controls your camera, left click controls your captain, right click controls your crew; well you are not exactly controlling anything, it's sort of... a command where the AI tries to follow it.The start can be tough for some people, initial stats are random you can end up with "useless" stats and you early game can be even "harder".There is a Morale and Hunger bar, most of the people tries to fill morale by paying salaries but you can do it for free at the tavern only pay salaries when you are really far from any town with a tavern or you crew wont listen to you and eventually they will attack you; Hunger is not a problem at all, your ship starts with 2 watermelons (2 servings each), once you learn cooking and fishing (and get a fishing rod) you will be fine, you can even sell extra fish to get more gold.It is a good game lots of fun so far, and i definitely recommend it, expect bugs/balance issues, but as a beta game that's to be expected, looking forward to 1.0 :)

content:
Posted: July 10, 2014
Early Access Review
								 I began by naming  myself Euguene Krabs, captured a crew of animals, a dog , a turtle and a crab. I forgot to buy food and almost starved.  A little later my crab died during a raid. I was demoralized. Then the turtle shortly after drowned after being knocked off the ship. I promised myself the same wouldn't happen with the dog. So I hired a REAL crew, the Krusty Krew. I had a cook , a poo cleaner a cannonneer , and 2 fighter specialists. Oh! Did we raid, we sunk many ships, killed dozens of natives, pooped everywhere, and drank rum all the time. But....unfortunately this game was early access.  After raiding a ship, you destroy it up to get its contents. The dog Douglass was on the  enemy ship and for some reason the command to carry him to ours wasn't working. So with tears in my eyes  I blew up the enemy ship and watched Douglass perish too. To this day me and my 8 man crew still pillag, still drink , and still laugh but we don't forget the original crew who set sail with me long before.....8/10 very fun, but will remind you occasionally that its early access.

content:
Posted: February 17, 2015
												Major Edit:Take this from a guy who's played it for more than an hour or five. This game is easy (Though no walk in the park), simple, repetitive and very hard to get into at first. The constant lag spikes, the annoying frequent speech patterns of the pirates, the constant cleaning of crap, INSANELY constant feeding and paying your crew, hell this game was a little hard for me to digest for a while. But I stuck it out.I found quickly, that while the game was annoying in some areas, it actually held a lot of promise. The BGM was fun to listen to, never once had to turn down my volume (Despite some other reviews said), and I actually liked the ship battles. Sure, the enemy didn't start boarding your ship until later levels and your crew constantly stood around dying or killing themselves somehow, but I felt rewarded whenever I slaughtered them (Or died trying) to the very end and reaped my reward. It was satisfactory, to me.I was expecting (And will hopefully see it in Pixel Privateers) to see sea monsters, sirens, ginormous whales and other of those awesome pirate things that one would normally expect to see in a pirate game. Yet none of which were shown (Though the brief glimpse of the sharks were annoying rather because you couldn't fight (Or fish for) them). I'd still say this game was crap because of this.But.I actually stuck through it all, and not once did my complaints come to thought. I enjoyed the game, laughed at some of my own stupid (Gruesome) deaths and I only frowned whenever my game would crash (RARELY). The pixelated format of the game was fun, the controls were EASY to learn despite other reviews saying otherwise, the UI was alright AND you can turn off bloom (Which is a great way to reduce lag). The witty shanties that the pirates sang onboard or in the bars were fun to listen to, the interesting conversations that would go on ("I knew a pirate like you" "I got a jar of dirt!") and of course my all time favorite Pixel Pirate moments... flag and ship editing. I loved the hell out of both of those things, never have I ever been able to design a ship that would sail (No, not even in Sid Meyer's Pirates was I able to do this (Even though it is an older game)). And my flag (Which was usually a Terraria reference) was fun. Yeah, I disliked the limited color choices, and the small space for the drawing board, but it was still creative.Really. I hated a lot about this game, but I loved it all the same.So, for all of the liked and disliked features of the game... I'd still have tor reccomend it, hell screw if it's on sail or not. Try the game out for yourself, I did and I wasn't as disappointed as I thought I'd be.In fairness.I'd give this game a solid 7/10.(I wonder if they'll add multiplayer in Pixel Privateers?)

content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								Overall: 9/10Pixel Piracy is a fantastic game. Even in the Early Access state that it is in. I find that this game has a very high replayability factor and that is something I look for in the game. I mean come on! Who hasn't wanted to roam the seas stealing treasure and ships? And you get to build your own ship and crew from the ground up! All of which is different everytime you play. Even when you save your game, The world changes! I would recommend this game to anyone looking for an adventure on the open seas!For those of you reading some negative comments, I would like to shed some light on this:(I will not be giving you links to any of my points as I feel you are all capable of doing research for yourselves to base your opinion on.)1. This game is still in Early Access. I would suggest reading the Steam definition of "Early Access" Aside from that, I have seen several updates and changes. All of which have helped the overall game.2. "Bad graphics" Ok. We are in a time where graphics are no longer a factor in creating a great game. (minecraft, terarria, neo scavenger) These graphics are a personality choice and I find they compliment every aspect of the gameplay. 3. "Bad music" This goes back to the "Early Access" statement. Some devs have this amazing idea for a game but no money or staff to quickly make a game. So the solution is to create an early access game, get some money, hire more people, get better results. So, recently The devs have acquired enough money to hire actual composers to make music. GIVE IT TIME. 4. "Repetitive gameplay" Once again, yes it is Early Access and some acpects will be sort of repetitive until the Devs get to it. (they have their own list of priorities)  Personally, I feel every game ever made has repetitive gameplay. Name a game that doesnt. If you hit a key more than once and it achieves the same outcome more than once, that its a repeat. The simple fact that this game will offer different encounters, stats, islands, cities, etc is a fantastic solution to the "repetitive gameplay" I'm sure by the full release there will be so many different things to do that you'll be satisfied with the game.5. The devs took our money and ran. WRONG ON SO MANY LEVELS! Read the change log. Watch videos on older version of this game. This game chances everytime I play it. And if this game was a scam, why would Re-Logic invest money into contaminating Terarria with this scam. You have to remember that it takes time to assemble a team to create the best game you can. (play game dev tycoon for proof) The devs are very much using our money for more staff and better plans to give you the best game they can. Read Alex's post for your self.These were just a few of the negative comments I have see that I personally disagree with. This game is fantastic as we as the devs creating it. I want to thank all of you who read to the bottom of this post, and I hope to see you on the game! If you have anyfurther questions about the game or any of my points, I would be happy to lend a hand. Thanks and keep gaming!Also, Alex(dev) thank you for making this game. I'm extremely happy with the game. I would even buy it again for a friend! I am a huge supporter of early access games, Give the smaller guys a chance to shine. Shine on man!

content:
Posted: May 13, 2014
Early Access Review
This review is for version 0.6.5 BETAPixel Piracy holds much potential, that's what I wanted to say first. However, the game is currently in beta and it is far from completed. The interface is rather confusing and there are game-breaking bugs which only a restart and reload of an old save will solve. The game balance is very off, especially when the AI can easily be defeated by a single person. You can beat an army of enemies with just your captain by  pausing the game and use the move&attack button on an enemy. The AI will stop doing whatever they were doing for a short while after you issued the command. In this way, you can hit an enemy, pause the game, give a new order and watch your captain slaughter all enemies without them fighting back. There are several other annoyances, such as missing scroll bars if you collected many items, and the weird interface for your crew, as well as poop. So much poop on your ship! Pirates need to eliminate from time to time and will do so on your ship. You can teach your people to clean, but for some reason, the cleaning rate is lower than pooping rate, so you will end up having a ship full of poop.Nevertheless, I can not only list the bad stuff, can I? I love the art/graphic style. It's simple, yes, but it's very beautiful. I also like the sound and the smooth animations and transitions of the interface. The game's core concept is great, I want to play this, just explore one more island and fight one more legendary boss. But right now, there is little to be explored. I hope they will add much content (or modding support?). All in all, I had and still have fun with this game, even in the current state, so I can recommend this game to people who want to support the developers and can take a peek into the game, but not to people who want to have a finished game.

								Pixel Piracy...It can be super annoying sometimes to get to an amazingly easy to defeat island, when all of a sudden your highest leveled character decides he doesn't know how to use a rope and falls into the ocean. But that's all part of this game. It's the most fun I've ever had on a roguelike game, and that's not usually something I say about the genre. number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 27, 2015
												I didn't pick up this game until I heard that Re-Logic got some help from another developer and started fixing up some of the problems that the community had with this title and overall making this game great.That said, it's definitely worth playing.I was surprised at how deep the game is.  Each pirate you recruit, including yourself, can level up which allows you to allocate stat points on them, give them certain skills or jobs like fishing or cleaning up the ship, as well as giving each pirate a unique personality and a little bit of backstory.  There's a ton of weapons, skills, little gimmicks that you can add on to your ship to boost certain attributes or your pirates' abilities, and a lot of customization when it comes to building your ship.The UI, menus, and the controls maybe take a little bit to get used to.  It's all cluttered and hard to figure out how to navigate through them, and it's hard to know how exactly to take off blocks and add blocks to your ship.  There's also not much explanation on items in the stores so you won't really know how skills work until you spend the gold on them and try them out.  After some time with the game, this all becomes easy to deal with.When you make your world, you choose what kind of history it has and what kind of pirate you'll be, and then the world is randomly generated.  Each town and island offers something different, although it starts to get a little repetitive as an island will usually just have hostile inhabitants and maybe a treasure chest.Battles are pretty difficult at times, but rewarding whenever you get an opportunity to capture a cooler ship than the one you currently have or to blow it up and gain the loot.  The game starts to get easy once you hire a bunch of pirates and level up their stats to crazy levels to where you'll almost never lose.  It does start to become a problem as there is too much crew management rather than actually playing the game, since you have to level up each individual pirate as well as equip them with the best weapons and passive items you've got.  This starts becoming time consuming once you get to a crew size over 10+ pirates, and would maybe benefit from an auto-level up and auto-equip feature.I'm happy with this game and would love to see some more updates to it with more exciting content.  I know there's still a lot for me to see and a lot more challenges to come my way.

message telling you to kill the 4 most famouse pirates, other than that you are on your own, there is little to no tutorial, so it takes a while to understand how to control your crew and to understand what the hell you are doing, once you get it, you pretty much fly through the sea smashing everything that gets on your way.my suggestion in this area is that you start with a small crew of 3 people at least, once cleaning one cooking and the captain, cause it gets anoying to see the ship get all covered in poop all the time for the first 3 days before you buy the skill. gameplay:pretty good, you manage your captain and crew using left and right click left for captain, right for crew, you cand assign crew members different groups so you can manage a few at a time usefull when you have huge♥♥♥♥♥crews, you travel across the map exploring, thou you wont see the places you have already visited, but rather a small portion of the map relative to where you are, it get bigger in the late game depending of dome skills you buy. you can buy skills for your crew therefore make them whatever you want, I feel this is both good  and bad, cause you depend on finding certain skill to do certain things with your crew, for instance fishing, cleaning and using cannons.you cant cutomize your crew in a visual way, but you may change their weapons and equipment depending on what you need them too, weapons have several stats and will be useful for things like pushing off your ship the enemy, hitting several at a time, or fighting on long range, althou you archers wont be able to attack from your ship or neither the cannons will work once you are in boarding range. you have no more indications than to go there or kill that to your crew so the combat its pretty simple and some times repetitive.the best thing is the ship customization, you can shape your ship whatever way you want, althou some designs simply doesnt work thus limiting how your ship is, also ships dont serve any other porpuse than been the shield you use prior boarding and toilet/dinner table. music/sound:pretty cool actually thou some music doesnt fit the mood and some pirate chanting would be nice specially when traveling cause it gets boaring fast, specially when going trough long distances, maybe some music boxes, also the sounds pirate make while speaking can get very repetitive too. graphics:GREAT! thou island may look almost all the same depending on where you are and in general looks a bit too blurry to be well apreciated, would love to see also more decorations for ships and envyroment, also the lack of sea life or waves in the sea, and more weather variations. endgame:once you become the lord of the seas there isnt much left to do except smash every asian or imperial ship you see, other than that you are ♥♥♥♥d up cause your crew will be a huge mass of ultramarines right from warhammer universe and will cut as soft butter any enemy they face and its serious, cause in some runs I had only my captain single handed taking down an imperial ship pretty cool thou but still no challenge.my final score is 6 / 10 will make it higher as this game show more content.

content:
Posted: May 25, 2014
Early Access Review
								Not linear in the slightest, pretty much no limits to how you want to design your ship, if you have the resources. The combat system is okay, but it might take a while to figure out how to use it effectively. You earn EXP by killing enemies, using items that give a certain amount to the crew member of your choosing, or just by sailing from island to island. The most interesting part to me was that you don't have much character customization when creating one, but instead the game offered world customization. You can choose what the main problem is, how your character views the world, and what's going to appear the most (pirates, monsters, etc...) I would definately recommend this game to anybody that likes a unique experience every time they start a new game.  (7/10)

content:
Posted: March 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								My addiction is high with this one. I got it and I instantly played it for like 3 hours. Learnt the controls and what not. Its SO much fun :D! Ok. Your a pirate. Out to get 'booty', a crew, food and booty. Along the way there are problems like unhappy crew, enemies on land and water, and money shortages. This game gets a 9/10 from me. I dont know what it is but its one of those games you play for a little bit, decide to take a break in 10 minutes, but 2 hours later you havent taken your eyes off it. It has a slight repeating factor to it, but it helps it. Most of the money and food I get is from enemy ships after I plunder them. I always like starting off with a first mate, just because you arent alone in the beginning. Then I really come to like the first crew guy ( mainly because they have a low pay-requirement ) and I tend to teach them EVERYTHING. If you can manage to get to guns and cannons and having a big crew with an even bigger ship, you can make it pretty far. In all honesty, im taking my time. I have played for 10 hours but im only at pirates with lvl 4 difficulty. You learn from mistakes, and the saving system is nice. I have little complaints. I really want to catch parrots and animals and slaves, but apparently thats not a feature yet even though the provide the requirements. Thats a little pet peeve of mine I guess. Your given things you cant get to without patience. But I know those are going to be provided in later updates ( Note : It updates often ). This is definetly a must try and I would gladly recommend it.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 30, 2014
												Starting off, I do really like this game. I'd give it a 6/10. I played enough of it to gauge how it plays, and overall it is quite an enjoyable experience. It is one of those games that you could play for hours and not even notice how the time flies. "So why not a better score?" you may ask. For a few reasons. 1. The GUI     The menu is one of those that feels like it should be super smooth but isn't. While most of the time it is intuitive, some parts of it are very hard to inderstand, like how there is no "back" button after selecting a crewmember (or maybe I'm blind). It can also feel a bit clunky when it takes a second or two to load the Map.2. The Graphics     Yes, they're there. Yes, they're pixely. Yes, there is only one backround for big islands and one for the sea. Players want something interesting to look at while they decapitate turtles named Charlie, and a repeating forest tile isn't interesting.3. The Gameplay     The other stuff has been superficial, so lemme divide this a bit more:          a. Controlling Pirates               It's really wonky. There is barely any tutorialization with it (along with almost every other part of the game) and even then it sometimes doesn't do what one would want it to. If there was an actual tutorial in the game, it would fix a lot of its glaring problems.          b. Areas               There is next to no variation. There are Pirate encounters, Island encounters, and Towns. Islands are boring and give very little gold, Pirates are either super easy or super hard---there is no middle ground, and Towns sometimes don't give you what you want (I'm still looking for the end of my Bowstrip). With more, different areas, this game would be a thousand times better.          c. Sailing               Now I know this is gonna ruffle your feathers, but I actually like the "loading" aspect of the game. It adds charm. What I do not like, however, is what takes place while sailing. Nothing. Aside from a sea shanty or the sharpening of a blade on my grindstone, nothing happens. Again, no variety. All I see is the health tick up and hunger and moral tick down. If something were to happen of if my pirates would ACTUALLY CLEAN THAT♥♥♥♥♥♥OFF THE♥♥♥♥♥♥DECK then it would be a thouroughly enjoyable experience.So why a 6/10? The game sounds terrible! Nay, my friend, I love it. It is incredible addicting, almost a pokemon-esque type of feel. It's like I need to play, or I will die. And don't let that "time played= 4 hours" fool you. I played much more than that offline. Oh, and my ship is more beautiful than yours.If you like rouguelikes, non-story-driven RPG's, or evenarcade games, then Pixel piracy is for you. Plus, the dev is a cool dude. TL:DR: 6/10 but could be a 10/10P.S. Alex, I know you read every review, so I'd like to say a few things. Keep up the good work, and i left a message in that chat room that you said to PM you in. Cheers mate! ¡Dinero!

content:
Posted: March 13, 2014
Early Access Review
								"Heya there matey, ye shivers me timbers!" that is pretty much it.Now for real, this game is not for children, it is unforgiving, it is tactical, you have to take care of quite a lot aspects of your crew and ship management, and THE MOST important thing - your deck will often get pooped on.The biggest suprise for me was that this is not at all like Terraria or Starbound, you do not control your own character in a smash and hit way, it is much more like the old awesome "point and click rpgs" (like Baldurs Gate, Icewind Dale etc.). You control your captain and your crew by commands using just your mouse. But strangely enough how it is, it is not a flaw at all.I did not think that Pixel Piracy was so great. But to tell the truth this game is really one of the best I have played in a long time. It really can suck you in so easily, that you wont even know when to stop. Since you chop your first enemy in a half, youll be in pirate game heaven.10/10 and still improving !

content:
Posted: December 22, 2014
												This is a pretty good game (with quite a few bugs...)The good:1. Build your own ship,  You can make big ships that you can design 100% completely as you wish.2. Hire a huge crew,  In games like this with crew you can get i.e FTL (great game also recommend) you have a small crewin Pixel Piracy you can have a massive crew of over 20 people,  You can level them up teach them ect ect3.  A huge map with many encounters,  The encounters in the game can be islands towns ships and legendary ships (from what I have found)4.  Cheats!  If you want a more easy going sandbox mod you can use cheats to give you XP, Food, Moral, health, crew, money,  And rain thousands of cannon balls on your enemies.The bad:1 Glitches!  20 minutes in I ran into a glitch that stopped me from doing anything on that run.2 The controls,  Not the best in a game there not the worst but are hard and confusing to learn how to control everything3 The "Tutorial"  When you start you just get thrown in...  You can click "Help" and get some help but the explanation is not well done and leave you confused.4 Spelling!  I'm not the best speller ever i.e ^ but there is quite a few mistakes made in the game (Developers may not speak English native) but as'long as you don't have an o.c.d for spelling you will be fine.The ugly:MeRecommendation:  If the game is on sale go ahead it's very fun and ill be playing more 10 may be a bit for it but its still a good game worth the money.

content:
Posted: December 23, 2015
												This game is one the few cases where I have felt buyer's remorse. Do not buy it, not if it's on sale, not even if you have some coupon, just don't. The combat is wonky and a drag to watch, and doesn't bother to teach you any of the game mechanics. The game also has some really weird filter on it that makes it look weird. (but that's more personal preference) The crew AI is horrendous, and often take a couple seconds to respond to commands, and when you're fighting enemy ships, it can end up screwing you over a ton. All islands are identical, and often the only thing different is what enemies are on them. Same goes for towns, they are all similar. Don't do it, if you were to use the money that this game costed to buy a fork, and then stabbed your self in the cheek with said fork, it would be more worth it than buying this game. ♥♥♥♥ you Bixel Biracy

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 9, 2016
												It's incredibly difficult to understand what's going on and why. For example, the way you'll find out about the Scurvy mechanic is when your entire first expedition dies to it. There's an Interact button, God alone knows why it's not the left mouse button, but you'll be standing in front of a chest like a moron and using Google to figure it out. There are Pets, but aside from Chickens (who lay eggs) and Crabs and Parrots (who attack) there doesn't appear to be a reason to keep the poop machines aboard. Speaking of poop, fully a third of your crew will be devoted to cleaning it off your ship. And if you'd like people to fish while you're at sea or your captain to dig while on shore, or anyone to capture animals, you'd better be prepared to enter the very klunky interface to change their weapons, as there's no way to carry fishing poles, animal traps, or shovels without them being one of your two primary weapons.There's a good game here, somewhere, but it's only a small step closer to usability than Dwarf Fortress and not nearly as entertaining.

content:
Posted: April 6, 2015
												As far as I played Pixel Piracy, I can honestly say that it is a well made game. Fresh looks and a obviously Piracy related humour keep the fun levels high. It's way more than a poop game (a game you'd play while you... well you know ;) ) neither it is a fulltime gaming experience. A well drawn timefiller as I'd describe it. The Pirates you hire are never shut the hell up, so be aware of that, take it with humour or adjust the SFX of that :D I found it quite hard to get the hang of Pixel Piracy, as the base difficulty is 'kindly hard' when you first start. As like most well done indiegames, you actually have to spend a reasonable amount of time into learing the mechanics of the game. This is actually not a bad thing to point out at all. So if you're into Pirates and Indiegames, you definately should check it out!

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 2, 2015
												This game, has very BIG performance issues.I think developers should understand that, and they should understand it very clearly that even a small mistake on the code / programming architecture returns SO MANY users as a loss of time.Skyrim loads on 10 secs, this game needs 1:45 secs to get to the next square on level 3 sized boat and lowest resolution on lowest opengl graphics!As you can see i forced my chances to finish the game, even played it on worse than amiga graphics lowest resolution (with unreadable texts, duh) but it was atill a nightmare; I dont know maybe because save file started to get fat.I really like simple graphics games, and this game has really nice visuality. Those forests, animals, exaggerated painful death voices... So far so good. But black screens and texts really gives the feeling that development phase interrupted early. But they made some changes to the game and released as single player...When you have big lists of something, anything; this game starts to fk up. And by big lists i mean 20+ or so, sadly. This list can be items put on boat / items on inventory / number of pirates / treasures shown on map or even visited places on map or shop list changes from the initial game. You can easily test this by trying to sell your weapons, having more than 1 page of weapons. It tries to draw everything again or something. Or did they define everthing as 3D? These mistakes are easy to spot, as being very beginner level.You can be sure that Unity offers many solutions when it comes to performance. While these are happening on devs' territory, what was the Valve's side of the story again? They could put more clear performance restrictions, no?I think devs should hire an expert, pay him whatever he wants, then apologize from the players and release an update. This is the best thing to do for the both parties. They could really make some money with this game, it has cute sides. Or they could just leave the fixing and make it free.

content:
Posted: December 26, 2015
												The premise was promising: Terraria meets Sid Meier's Pirates, what could possibly go wrong?Well, a lot apparently.Right off the bat, the first problem I have is that I have no flipping clue what I'm doing. Nevermind all the arrs, the "tutorial" is hardly useful besides keeping you from dying before you even set sail. The interface is never explained in any notable detail, and the interface itself is unintuitive and badly designed. I still don't know how I'm supposed to save the game, even though the Exit Game button reminds me to, besides clicking that Exit Game button to force an autosave.The gameplay is also really really lacking. The premise of Terraria? No, not really. It's far better to capture better ships than to build your own, and unlike Terraria the interface just doesn't stimulate creativity. But what about the pirating, you ask? Nah, it's basically get some levels in the earlygame and then you're set; just tank the enemy ship if cannons are present and then just board with everyone and just win with sheer numbers. Same for islands, just with no cannons.Overall very disappointed. Was it worth the $1.49 I paid for because this was on sale? Maybe, I did spend a little under 5 hours on it. 32 cents per hour of entertainment? Meh, at least I didn't lose much.TL;DR: Boring, bad interface, only go for it if it's on sale and you are really interested.

content:
Posted: January 24, 2016
												As soon as I saw the developer's name, I SHOULD have thought twice about buying this game but I loved the idea so much I bought it anyway when it first came out.Basically, the game has not changed since launch and by change I mean "it hasn't been completed." ... Just like all his other games. It's a great tech demo in a long line of tech demos that never get finished. There's plenty of balance issues, the UI breaks down as you try and keep up with the non-stop micromanagement. You can die for completely B.S. reasons (bugs) and lose everything. Worst of all, the game just stops being fun after the novelty wears off. He never added anything more to do. Your experience never grows. The first 30 minutes of gameplay is the same as the last 30 minutes of gameplay as you become so bored and frustated you just stop playing.This is the last time I give this guy money. I've learned my lesson.

												This game is one the few cases where I have felt buyer's remorse. Do not buy it, not if it's on sale, not even if you have some coupon, just don't. The combat is wonky and a drag to watch, and doesn't bother to teach you any of the game mechanics. The game also has some really weird filter on it that makes it look weird. (but that's more personal preference) The crew AI is horrendous, and often take a couple seconds to respond to commands, and when you're fighting enemy ships, it can end up screwing you over a ton. All islands are identical, and often the only thing different is what enemies are on them. Same goes for towns, they are all similar. Don't do it, if you were to use the money that this game costed to buy a fork, and then stabbed your self in the cheek with said fork, it would be more worth it than buying this game. ♥♥♥♥ you Bixel Biracy

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 2, 2015
												This game, has very BIG performance issues.I think developers should understand that, and they should understand it very clearly that even a small mistake on the code / programming architecture returns SO MANY users as a loss of time.Skyrim loads on 10 secs, this game needs 1:45 secs to get to the next square on level 3 sized boat and lowest resolution on lowest opengl graphics!As you can see i forced my chances to finish the game, even played it on worse than amiga graphics lowest resolution (with unreadable texts, duh) but it was atill a nightmare; I dont know maybe because save file started to get fat.I really like simple graphics games, and this game has really nice visuality. Those forests, animals, exaggerated painful death voices... So far so good. But black screens and texts really gives the feeling that development phase interrupted early. But they made some changes to the game and released as single player...When you have big lists of something, anything; this game starts to fk up. And by big lists i mean 20+ or so, sadly. This list can be items put on boat / items on inventory / number of pirates / treasures shown on map or even visited places on map or shop list changes from the initial game. You can easily test this by trying to sell your weapons, having more than 1 page of weapons. It tries to draw everything again or something. Or did they define everthing as 3D? These mistakes are easy to spot, as being very beginner level.You can be sure that Unity offers many solutions when it comes to performance. While these are happening on devs' territory, what was the Valve's side of the story again? They could put more clear performance restrictions, no?I think devs should hire an expert, pay him whatever he wants, then apologize from the players and release an update. This is the best thing to do for the both parties. They could really make some money with this game, it has cute sides. Or they could just leave the fixing and make it free.

content:
Posted: January 12, 2014
Early Access Review
								Pixel Piracy is a pretty fun little game that is sure to entertain you for a few hours at least. While it could use some more polish and some of the interfacing could be a little better, it is not a complete game. You can build a pirate ship, starting from a few free blocks, and basically it's a pirate sim from there. Start from boarding other small crafts to shooting cannons from your gigantic ship. There is a few things to keep track of though and time management is also a factor. It's really a hard game and you will surely lose a lot when you first start but you learn what to do different every time. After it's updated, I'm sure I will be able to say that Pixel Piracy is one of my favorite indie games out there.

content:
Posted: June 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								I was expecting the same controls for Terraria/Arthur's Gold, but i was wrong.The controls are weird at first, Arrow keys/A D controls your camera, left click controls your captain, right click controls your crew; well you are not exactly controlling anything, it's sort of... a command where the AI tries to follow it.The start can be tough for some people, initial stats are random you can end up with "useless" stats and you early game can be even "harder".There is a Morale and Hunger bar, most of the people tries to fill morale by paying salaries but you can do it for free at the tavern only pay salaries when you are really far from any town with a tavern or you crew wont listen to you and eventually they will attack you; Hunger is not a problem at all, your ship starts with 2 watermelons (2 servings each), once you learn cooking and fishing (and get a fishing rod) you will be fine, you can even sell extra fish to get more gold.It is a good game lots of fun so far, and i definitely recommend it, expect bugs/balance issues, but as a beta game that's to be expected, looking forward to 1.0 :)

content:
Posted: July 10, 2014
Early Access Review
								 I began by naming  myself Euguene Krabs, captured a crew of animals, a dog , a turtle and a crab. I forgot to buy food and almost starved.  A little later my crab died during a raid. I was demoralized. Then the turtle shortly after drowned after being knocked off the ship. I promised myself the same wouldn't happen with the dog. So I hired a REAL crew, the Krusty Krew. I had a cook , a poo cleaner a cannonneer , and 2 fighter specialists. Oh! Did we raid, we sunk many ships, killed dozens of natives, pooped everywhere, and drank rum all the time. But....unfortunately this game was early access.  After raiding a ship, you destroy it up to get its contents. The dog Douglass was on the  enemy ship and for some reason the command to carry him to ours wasn't working. So with tears in my eyes  I blew up the enemy ship and watched Douglass perish too. To this day me and my 8 man crew still pillag, still drink , and still laugh but we don't forget the original crew who set sail with me long before.....8/10 very fun, but will remind you occasionally that its early access.
